headline.main: SAVED FROM A WRECK.; STORY OF A SURVIVOR OF THE LOST SHIP TURKISH EMPIRE.

docs.snippet: Theodore Steinert, quartermaster, and Alfred Anderson, seaman, the only known survivors of the crew of the lost steam-ship Emily B. Souder, gave testimony yesterday before the United States Local Inspectors of Steam Vessels as to the circumstances...
docs.lead_paragraph: Theodore Steinert, quartermaster, and Alfred Anderson, seaman, the only known survivors of the crew of the lost steam-ship Emily B. Souder, gave testimony yesterday before the United States Local Inspectors of Steam Vessels as to the circumstances attending the loss of that vessel.

headline.main: LOSS OF THE EMILY B. SOUDER.; STORY OF ONE OF THE SURVIVORS THE OFFICIAL INVESTIGATION.

docs.snippet: Reports were yesterday morning received from two sources to the effect that the steamer Emily B. Souden, which left this port on Dec. 8, had foundered, and that all hands on board, except two of the crew, had perished. From London the report came ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Reports were yesterday morning received from two sources to the effect that the steamer Emily B. Souden, which left this port on Dec. 8, had foundered, and that all hands on board, except two of the crew, had perished. headline.main: REPORTED LOSS OF THE STEAM-SHIP EMILY B. SOUDER.; ALL ON BOARD SAID TO BE LOST BUT TWO OF THE CREW--THE SURVIVORS LANDED AT KINGSTON, JAMAICA--SKETCH OF THE VESSEL AND LIST OF HER PASSENGERS, OFFICERS, AND CREW.
